sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The German foreign minister says her government would not stand in the way if other countries were to supply Leopard 2 tanks to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In a tit-for-tat move, Russia and Estonia have expelled one another's ambassadors amid increasing tensions between the two countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Life returning to normal in the Chinese city that many regard as the ground zero of the Covid pandemic, but fears remain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Germany's foreign minister says it wouldn't stand in the way if Poland were to give Leopard 2 tanks to Ukraine without its authorisation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Annalena Baerbock made the comment in an interview with French TV station LCI, in what appeared to be a first clear signal over the contentious issue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Warsaw has been waiting for the green light from Berlin to provide its armoured vehicles to Kyiv, and Poland's Prime Minister is clear on where he stands.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In a tweet, he said, if we don't get German agreement on the Leopards, we'll build a smaller coalition of countries ready to donate some of their modern tanks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In his nightly address, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said that the main focus of the war is the issue of defense.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: He explained that this week will be the time of appropriate decisions, and that solutions had already been prepared, which he says will be fair.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Zelensky also referred to the visit by former British Prime Minister Boris Johnson on Sunday, saying that the trip was symbolic, as it took place on Ukraine's Unity Day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Mr Johnson was recently awarded an Honorary Citizen of Kyiv Medal at the World Economic Forum in Davos.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: On the Russian side, the Kremlin claims its offensive operations have taken more advantageous lines and positions in the Kherson and the Zaporizhia regions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And on Friday, it claims it captured the village of Klishkivka, just nine kilometers from Bakhmut in eastern Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: However, there's been no official comment on the claim from the Ukrainians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But they did confirm that Russian forces are on the edge of Bakhmut, all of which will only increase pressure on the West for heavy-duty tanks to be delivered soon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Estonian Ambassador Markus Leidra entering his country's embassy in Moscow

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: just days before he's forced to leave Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: embassy in Moscow just days before he's forced to leave Russia. In a tit-for-tat move, Moscow and Tallinn have expelled one another's ambassadors amid increasing tensions between the two countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Moscow has accused Tallinn of Russiophobia after Estonia earlier this month ordered the Kremlin to radically reduce the size of its embassy staff in the country by the beginning of February.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It's the first time since the start of its war in Ukraine that Moscow has expelled an ambassador from a European Union country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Both diplomatic representatives are to return home by the 7th of February.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Estonia and Russia say that missions in their respective capitals will now be headed by charge d'affaires, meaning that diplomatic relations will be operating at a reduced level.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Three years on and the suspected ground zero of the Covid pandemic remains shattered and silent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Soon after the mysterious virus was first reported, Wuhan fish market was closed and the city of 11 million residents went into lockdown.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Other dormant reminders are still in place, such as the hastily erected emergency hospital, and for citizens, the trauma is still fresh in the memory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It's not been easy doing anything this past few years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Everyone's been facing different levels of hardship in work and life.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Of course we were scared.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: This year was the first time people started being widely infected.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Last year and over the past three years, no one was infected.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: A new year will of course be better. We're not afraid of the virus now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We don't have that fear in our hearts anymore. By the time Chinese authorities moved into close of Huanan seafood and wildlife market, the new virus was already spreading around China and inevitably the world. Shocking images from Wuhan's hospitals foretold of a global health crisis, not seen in decades, if not centuries. Today, Wuhan seems relatively normal as it enters a new year, but the pandemic's toll is all too evident and amid a fresh up surge in cases across the country, there's anxiety that the nightmare may not yet be over.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: yet be over.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: This is a call for peace and a demand for all nuclear weapons to be destroyed. That's what the International Physicians for Prevention of Nuclear War were calling for as they demonstrated in front of Hamburg City Hall on Sunday. The Nobel Peace Prize winning organization began in the 80s by U.S. and Soviet doctors against the nuclear arms race.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The protesters are concerned the war in Ukraine increases the risk of such weapons being used.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Especially for the biggest nuclear weapon countries, Russia and US, which is also involved indirectly in the war, they have to declare that they will not use nuclear weapons in this war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: No first use of nuclear weapons.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This protest is marking the two-year anniversary of a UN treaty banning the use of nuclear weapons. It's believed that Russia would most likely deploy weapons that are tactical or so-called small. But experts at a conference leading up to this demonstration said there is no such thing as a small nuclear weapon. It has a range of up to 40 kilometers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It's not just weapons that worry the campaigners. They also talked about the threats of nuclear energy and the potential damage from possible accidents from power plants around the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: International experts are pushing for a protection zone around Ukraine's largest plant at Zaporizhia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: To enforce some sort of zones around them so that they are not in any danger of being hit by missiles, bombs or shelling.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: So that would minimize the risk, but again, it won't remove the risk entirely because meltdowns can still happen from loss of power or human error.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Another group of experts will highlight the risks of nuclear weapons on Tuesday. The Bulletin of the Atomic Scientists will update their doomsday clock, symbolizing how close they think humans are to self-annihilation.

sentences.sentence: The Japanese pastry chefs were up against teams from 17 countries, with each nation fielding experts in chocolate, sugar and ice cream.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: This year the theme was about climate change.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: All entrants had to produce desserts without any colourings or additives.

sentences.sentence: Thousands of people protested in Lisbon against the legal limbo of animal protection legislation

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: in Portugal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Public prosecutors want the Constitutional Court to declare as unconstitutional an existing law that criminalises those who mistreat their pets with a fine or jail time.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The court argues the country's constitution can't protect pets as if they were humans. Demonstrators say they're tired of rescuing stray animals every day and say that animals don't have a voice and should have.

sentences.sentence: Wintry showers brought down power lines across southern provinces of Poland at the weekend. Freezing rain brought black ice, making roads treacherous.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: One of Princess Diana's favourite dresses is going up for auction at Sotheby's on January 27th and is expected to fetch between 73,000 and 110,000 euros.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The purple velvet dress was designed by Victor Edelstein and was famously worn by Diana in her 1997 Vanity Fair photo shoot.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The dress is part of Sotheby's The One auction.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Other items include an invite to President JFK's famous birthday party where Marilyn Monroe popped out of a cake.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Another item up for grabs is basketball superstar LeBron James' jersey from the 2013 NBA Finals.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It took just seconds for rioters to destroy dozens of priceless treasures, but restoring them will take weeks and months.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In Brazil's Congress Museum, specialists are painstakingly trying to return the artifacts to their former splendor.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The raiders didn't just ransack government buildings in Brasilia, they attacked the paintings, sculptures and even antique chairs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It arrived in a very deteriorated condition. Now it already looks much better, but it's still all damaged. It has broken legs and armrests, both armrests, two legs and the side of the backrest.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The restoration work is just one of the aftershocks of the assault on Brazil's capital by supporters of ex-president Jair Bolsonaro.
